intro: Cephaelis abouabouensis, commonly known as the Abouabou mountainflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
